data.title: ICC World Test Championship: List of Winners & Runners
data.meta_description: ICC World Test Championship played between Australia vs India from 7th to 11th June 2023 at The Oval Ground and The WTC winner of 2023 is Australia.
data.text:
The World Test Championship Winner for season 2021/23 is Australia, where they have beat India by 209 Runs. For the current season, ICC introduced a new points system and a brand new program. In the previous tournament held between 2019/21, the World Test Championship Winners were New Zealand, who defeated India by 8 wickets.

The ICC World Test Championship is played by the best global cricket teams, who all compete to win the trophy for the world’s premier Test cricket tournament. We have shared the details about all the previous year’s winners of this test cricket tournament here.

World Test Championship 2023/24 Season 3 Begins Now.

ICC World Test Championship

The ICC World Test Championship is an international cricket competition organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC) for the ten test cricket-playing nations. This tournament maintains a rating system based on all Test matches played throughout the cricketing season. According to the rating system of the Test Championship:

Winning a Test Championship final earns you the highest points.

If a team wins, it earns points. If the team loses, it receives fewer points.

In the event of a tie, the lower-rated team will be favoured at the expense of the higher-rated team.

The ICC Chief presents the ICC Test Championship mace to the World Test Championship winner, coupled with a $1 million cash reward. Australia is dominating as World Test Championship Winner by winning the trophy in the last tournament conducted between 2021/23 also New Zealand won World Test Championship by winning the trophy in the last tournament conducted between 2019/21.

Test Championship - Point Scoring System

The ICC agreed that in the World Test Championship, regardless of the series duration, the same amount of points would be available from each series so that countries who played fewer Tests would not be penalized. Points are given based on a team's performance in a Test rather than a series. If a match is 'dead rubber' where the result of a series match is predecided, points are evenly split between playing teams.

In a five-match series, 20 per cent of the points would be accessible each match, whereas 50 per cent of the points would be available each match in a two-match series. The ICC also agreed that a tie is worth half a victory, and a draw is worth a third of a win. According to the points system of the ICC World Test Championship:

A team receives 12 points and 100% in case of a win.

A team receives 4 points and 33.33% in case of a draw.

A team receives 6 points and 50% in case of a tie.

A team receives 0 points if they lose the match

FAQs on World Test Championship Winners

Q1. Who is leading the World Test Championship 2021/23?

Australia is leading the 2021/23 World Test Championship with 136 points. India is close behind in the second position with 123 points, and Sri Lanka is currently on 64 points. The highest number of points earned in the matches will determine the ICC World Test Championship Winner.

Q2. Who was the World Test Championship Winner in 2021/23?

The World Test Championship Winner of 2021/23 season were Australia. Australia played against India and won India by 209 Runs to claim the 2nd Season of ICC World Test Championship.

Q3. Who was the World Test Championship Winner in 2019/21?

The World Test Championship Winners in the 2019/21 season were New Zealand. New Zealand played against India in a heavy downpour. Regardless, New Zealand defeated India by eight wickets to claim the ICC World Test Championship mace for the 2019/21 season.

Q4. How many times has India won the World Test Championship?

India has not been an ICC World Test Championship Winner yet. The last World Test Championship was held in 2019/21, which was won by New Zealand. India has a high chance of winning the World Test Championship 2021/23, as it is currently in second position with a score of 99.
